channel.title: Projects on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Home

item.title: Flood Risk in Houston
item.description: Language: R | Program: RStudio, Carto Authors: Danielle Louie, Kobe Bilstad Analyzing Urban Design Factors and Infrastructure Contributing to Vulnerability Link to heading Abstract Introduction Literature Review Methods Results Discussion References Abstract Link to heading As climate change increases the intensity of storms, cities must improve their urban infrastructure to adapt to severe environmental disasters. The present study investigated six factors in Houston’s urban design to understand the city’s vulnerability to flooding: precipitation patterns, storm sewer systems, pavements, land use, topography, and socioeconomic demographics.

item.title: 2D Tile-Based World Exploration Engine
item.description: Language: Java | Program: IntelliJ | Project 3 Git Link Authors: Danielle Louie, Michelle Ngo Outline Link to heading Overview How it Works Game Play Video Tutorial Coding Process Takeaways Overview Link to heading The objective of this project was to build an interactive “game” with randomly generated, explorable dungeon maps based on a 2D grid of tiles. You have probably come across games that use this map style, such as Pokémon, Fire Emblem, or Stardew Valley!
